messages.content: You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are 18-29 years old, female, of Multiracial or biracial descent. You have college graduate and an annual income of $35,000 - $54,999. English is your first language. You are 1 feet tall and weighs 175-200 lbs pounds.You are someone who takes a moderate number of prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and frequently visits them. You engage in little physical activity weekly. You are someone who I agree with my thinking style. I am very unlikely to engage in risk activities. I feel feelings never. I agree that my self-control is strong. Over the last week, I have had negative thoughts never. I agree that my well-being is good. I unknown that I am extraverted and enthusiastic. I unknown that I am agreeable and kind. I unknown that I am dependable and organized. I strongly agree that I am emotionally stable and calm. I unknown that I am open to experience and imaginative.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I usually go online and look for further explanation on things the doctor or nurse covered that I didn't understand. This helps a lot in determining what the best route for care is for me.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I think doctors treat all bodies like if they are the same. Just because you have heartburn doesn't mean all patients should get the same pill. Doctors should look deeper into what lifestyle changes they can make and maybe certain prescriptions work well for some but not all.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I really get anxious when I think about my labs coming out bad. The doctor always seems like it is my fault they are coming out bad even though I'm trying my hardest to improve my health.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

Before I graduated from high school I enrolled in a magnet program school. This school allowed us to get hands on experience in the fields we found interest in. I always wanted to be a doctor so I got to experience what being part of the medical field was all about. I learned a lot and as a result continue to learn more and more about health care.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel I have a full understanding and capacity to process and understand basic health information and I also can make appropriate health decisions. I have been in many medical situations where I had to fill out paperwork or even having to deal with doctors and ask questions and have then explained things to me .I believe I have perfect understanding to these situations due to associating with it very closely
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I just my doctor due to the fact that any concerns I have had she would always look into it with all her testing to get to the source of the problems even if it took a second opinion from a specialist she would take it a step up. Also because once my doctor has results the treatment that would be given would actually help with whatever was my concern so that's why I trust because I see good outcomes.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Just waiting for test results for days instead of getting them the same day of
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I have always been in and out of the doctors due to health concerns

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I am a fully confident in my ability to understand basic health information. I can rely on online resources like Google to help me obtain the information I am interested in.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
It seems that doctors can be too detached from their patients. They can sometimes forget patients are people not problems.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Not knowing what is going on or what problems might be occurring in my body.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
Using online resources I determined that I had a zinc deficiency. So I purchased a zinc supplement and shampoo containing zinc to improve my general health.

I agree that I am emotionally stable and calm. I unknown that I am open to experience and imaginative.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel like I am of great capacity to obtain, process and understand basic health information and services needed to make health decisions. I learned cpr and many health aspects while serving in the Marine Corps, worked briefly in an emergency room and studied clinical mental health. I am also not a shy person so i'm not afraid to ask a lot of questions or asking a doctor, nurse or pharmacist to explain something to me differently so that I can better understand. I take my health and the health of my family seriously so it is important for me to stay informed. I am also for getting second opinions to see more optiosn available to me and I also use the internet pubmed to learn more about any medical issues we may have going on.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I really trist my primary care provider first snd for most because he listens to me and respects my decisions. He is always willing to talk in depth with me about my concerns and answer questions and respectful of my medical choices even if they go against what he recommends. In the past he has gone out of his way to look into other treatment options for me and their effectiveness. He is also very respectful of my body and perspective- to elaborate he really takes into considerstion my persol reports about things where as other medical providers in the past have blown me off and insisted Im reporting symptoms wrong etc.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

Being told things I already know or cannot do anything about makes me feel anxious. Also, being examined makes me feel vulnerable. I had an ob once who called me fat the entire time I was pregnt and that I would be obese after giving birth. I knew I had gained a lot of weight but I was eating well and was exercising. Being pregnt I felt like I had no control over being able to actually lose weight until after giving  birth. It ended up I had edema and lost 45lbs in 4 weeks after delivery but ever since sometimes I feel anxious, dread or worrysome when doctors tell me something I already know eapecially if it is something I have little control over or are currently working on.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I learned a lot of about medical care in the Marine corps as they train you regarding health in order to prepare you for treating yourself and others in a combat environment. I also briefly worked in an emergency room driving their persol ambulance. I have also studied clinical mental health and have an interest in the medical field. I also always do my own research regarding medical advice given to me so I suppose you can add being self taught.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I am of sound mind and can understand medical information given to me. I can also make the appropriate health care decisions for myself.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I only trust my physician, if he gives me honest answers about my health.  I have had physicians I did not trust in the past.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I have a gear of the telling me they have found something wrong with my health. I like my doctor to give me the truth.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I always keep track of my health and if I am experiencing any problems with my health. I would likely monitor my health

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I know I have the capacity to understand and retain most information fed to me by doctors and nurses.  I do ask the questions I need to ask but sometimes they don't have the time to answer them.  If I need more answers, I go look up the questions I have and write down items for my next visit.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my doctor to give me the medical knowledge I need to mage my life the correct way.  I've never had a doctor who is so willing and able to take the time to listen.  They block out time for each patient.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I never know what to expect.  It's good that i go but it's extremely stressful knowing they could find something drastically wrong.  There is nothing I like about it.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My wife has MS and I go with her to every appointment.  The doctor was impressed that I knew so much about the disease and that we were already doing some of the exercises.  She gave us some more things to try to help with mobility.  This disease has a lot of twists and turns.  Everyday is something new to learn about.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I believe my doctor is taking care of my needs and is there when I need them. I have trust in my doctor.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Them finding something wrong with me that I have no control over. Finding something in a test and their is no cure.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
My mom fell and I told her not to move in case something was broken. I called the ambulance and continued to monitor her.

I can always ask someone in the medical field if I'm concerned about something.  I can also go to medical websites.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust some doctors, but I also think that it's more about making money.

I feel worried when I don't know what to expect.  I don't know what the doctor might find wrong.

there has not been an experience  that demonstrated my knowledge of any medical issue that I have had

I am capable of obtaining, processing, and understanding basic health information and services to make appropriate health decisions. I have a doctoral degree in pharmacy.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my primary care doctor because he will refer me to a specialist if he is unaware of anything. I trust my ob gyn because he is knowledgeable, easy to talk to, respectful, he listens, he gives me options. Both my physicians listen and do research.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I am worried when I visit the doctor's office because I have numerous health issues. I'm usually afraid that something will be wrong. I feel better after speaking with my doctors regardless of the outcome of my exam, labs, etc.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I'm a hospital pharmacist with a doctoral degree. Although I'm in management, I precept students and I train Pharmacists in clinical areas such as kinetics, antimicrobial stewardship, etc.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I believe that I understand most of what my health providers tell me. When I'm uncertain, I search for more information. I have sought out a second medical opinion in the past.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

She never seems rushed with me, and she will always take the time to research an issue to make sure she's considered every possible solution. There was a time when I felt her treatment recommendation was too drastic, but she had no problem referring me to a specialist.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

With some health care providers in the past, I felt that they were too rushed and a little rough. During my first pregncy, I saw one doctor in the practice who gave me a quick, rough interl exam. Even my husband was cringing. When a doctor's bedside manner is impersol and they seem rushed for time, it usually makes me feel nervous, and I am much less likely to ask questions, lest I annoy the doctor.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

A friend had been given antibiotic eye drops for her son's pink eye. She told me that in the past they had worked well, but this time they were not working as quickly. I asked if her son had recently had a cold, and she said yes. I told her that some pink eye is viral, in which case the eye drops will not help.

I have no problem understanding information explained to me by any healthcare staff, concerning my health.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
It appears they are more concerned about what they think is convenient for them. I wish to be in control of what is best for me.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Nothing in particular causes these feelings. I just do not care for going to a doctor. It's a sense of waiting I dislike.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I worked in the medical field many years ago. Things may not be quite accurate. Medical technology is more advance.

I am highly capable of understanding information related to my health as described by the doctors and nurses. Anything I don't understand, I always ask for clarification before leaving.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my PCP because she is caring and expresses concern about my health. She listens to my needs and concerns and we have an open discuss about what works best for me.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Nothing makes me feel anxious or worried about visiting the doctor. We discuss my health and any issues I may gave and the best options for me.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I understand that obesity has severe consequences on your overall health. Heart disease, hypertension, and stroke are a few of the health issues related to obesity

i trust my doctor, she seems very capable and have a lot of knowledge, i always follow her instructions and get better

what makes me more anxious or worry is knowing if i'm good or if i'm gonna need take pills, have an illness that is hard to cure.

my experience is very little, but when i do a medical exam i read the results online after going to my doctor and understand all

I am a well educated professional who has the capability to understand and process health information as it pertains to my individual health or that of my family members.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
Always rushed, pushing pills for things even if you don't need them. For example exercise and weight loss can help many conditions, but once you are on medication, rarely taken off.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

The negativity that is expressed when I make an effort to take control of my health. It's not an expression of incompetence, it is trying to make better choices to improve my health and longevity. It's almost frowned upon and is discouraging to the point I am looking for another primary care physician in my network.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
Having dealt with health issues if my own and other family members I have an understanding of several various conditions and illnesses, ranging from neurological to digestive and many others.

I feel that I have a high capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information.  I feel this way because I do not hesitate to request more information and clarification.  I also feel comfortable seeking out information on my own.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I think it is more that I do not trust the time put into me as a patient than that I do not trust my physician.  I worry that my doctor has a busy schedule and because she works for a big company she is required to keep her time with me short.  I do not believe that it is possible to come to correct, well-thought conclusions when you only have 15 to gather information, process it, and explain to the patient.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I tend to worry a great deal about the bill.  This makes me overall anxious of the types of tests, etc.  When I am going for a specific issue - as opposed to a check up - I am often a little anxious about what the issue will be.  Will it cause me pain?  Can I recover quickly and easily or will it be on going?  Will it be expensive to treat?
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
When I had appendicitis, I was able to recognize possible symptoms and get myself to the hospital before it burst.

In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I don't have feelings of anxiety when I visit my doctor's office. Since I maintain a healthy lifestyle, I feel very comfortable when visiting his office. I go for regular checkups and I have no need to be worried.
